member.name: T:Accord.DirectSound.AudioCaptureDevice
member.summary: Audio source for local audio capture device (i.e. a microphone).

remarks.para: This audio source captures audio data obtained from a local audio capture device such as the microphone. The audio is captured using DirectSound through SlimDX.
For instructions on how to list capture devices, please see the documentation page.

example.para: For more details regarding usage, please check one of the Audio sample applications accompanying the framework.

member.name: E:Accord.DirectSound.AudioCaptureDevice.NewFrame
member.summary: New frame event.

remarks.para: Notifies clients about new available frame from audio source.

para.note: Since audio source may have multiple clients, each client is responsible for making a copy (cloning) of the passed audio frame, because the audio source disposes its own original copy after notifying of clients.

member.name: E:Accord.DirectSound.AudioCaptureDevice.AudioSourceError
member.summary: Audio source error event.
member.remarks: This event is used to notify clients about any type of errors occurred in audio source object, for example internal exceptions.

member.name: P:Accord.DirectSound.AudioCaptureDevice.Source
member.summary: Audio source.
member.remarks: Audio source is represented by Guid of audio capture device.

member.name: P:Accord.DirectSound.AudioCaptureDevice.Format
member.summary: Gets or sets the sample format used by the device.

member.name: P:Accord.DirectSound.AudioCaptureDevice.DesiredFrameSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the desired frame size.

member.name: P:Accord.DirectSound.AudioCaptureDevice.Channels
member.summary: Gets the number of audio channels captured by the device. Currently, only a single channel is supported.

member.name: P:Accord.DirectSound.AudioCaptureDevice.FramesReceived
member.summary: Received frames count.
member.remarks: Number of frames the audio source provided from the moment of the last access to the property.

member.name: P:Accord.DirectSound.AudioCaptureDevice.BytesReceived
member.summary: Received bytes count.
member.remarks: Number of bytes the audio source provided from the moment of the last access to the property.

member.name: P:Accord.DirectSound.AudioCaptureDevice.UserData
member.summary: User data.
member.remarks: The property allows to associate user data with audio source object.

member.name: P:Accord.DirectSound.AudioCaptureDevice.IsRunning
member.summary: State of the audio source.
member.remarks: Current state of audio source object - running or not.

member.name: M:Accord.DirectSound.AudioCaptureDevice.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:Accord.DirectSound.AudioCaptureDevice.#ctor(Accord.DirectSound.AudioDeviceInfo)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:Accord.DirectSound.AudioCaptureDevice.#ctor(System.Guid)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: Global identifier of the audio capture device.

member.name: M:Accord.DirectSound.AudioCaptureDevice.#ctor(System.Guid,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: Global identifier of the audio capture device.
The device name or description string.

member.name: M:Accord.DirectSound.AudioCaptureDevice.Start
member.summary: Start audio source.
member.remarks: Starts audio source and return execution to caller. audio source object creates background thread and notifies about new frames with the help of event.

member.name: M:Accord.DirectSound.AudioCaptureDevice.SignalToStop
member.summary: Signals audio source to stop its work.
member.remarks: Signals audio source to stop its background thread, stop to provide new frames and free resources.

member.name: M:Accord.DirectSound.AudioCaptureDevice.WaitForStop
member.summary: Wait for audio source has stopped.
member.remarks: Waits for source stopping after it was signaled to stop using method.

member.name: M:Accord.DirectSound.AudioCaptureDevice.Stop
member.summary: Stop audio source.

remarks.para: Stops audio source aborting its thread.

para.note: Since the method aborts background thread, its usage is highly not preferred and should be done only if there are no other options. The correct way of stopping camera is signaling it stop and then waiting for background thread's completion.

member.name: M:Accord.DirectSound.AudioCaptureDevice.Free
member.summary: Free resource.

member.name: M:Accord.DirectSound.AudioCaptureDevice.WorkerThread
member.summary: Worker thread.

member.name: M:Accord.DirectSound.AudioCaptureDevice.OnNewFrame(System.Array)
member.summary: Notifies client about new block of frames.
member.param: New frame's audio.

member.name: P:Accord.DirectSound.AudioCaptureDevice.CanSeek
member.summary: Gets whether this audio source supports seeking.

member.name: M:Accord.DirectSound.AudioCaptureDevice.Seek(System.Int32)
member.summary: This source does not support seeking.

member.name: P:Accord.DirectSound.AudioCaptureDevice.SampleRate
member.summary: Gets or sets the desired sample rate for this capturing device.

member.name: M:Accord.DirectSound.AudioCaptureDevice.Finalize
member.summary: Releases unmanaged resources and performs other cleanup operations before the is reclaimed by garbage collection.

member.name: M:Accord.DirectSound.AudioCaptureDevice.Dispose
member.summary: Performs application-defined tasks associated with freeing, releasing, or resetting unmanaged resources.

member.name: M:Accord.DirectSound.AudioCaptureDevice.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Releases unmanaged and - optionally - managed resources
member.param: true to release both managed and unmanaged resources; false to release only unmanaged resources.

member.name: T:Accord.DirectSound.AudioDeviceCategory
member.summary: Audio Device Category.

member.name: F:Accord.DirectSound.AudioDeviceCategory.Capture
member.summary: Capture audio device, such as a microphone or audio-in.

member.name: F:Accord.DirectSound.AudioDeviceCategory.Output
member.summary: Output audio device, such as speakers or headphone jacks.

member.name: T:Accord.DirectSound.AudioDeviceCollection
member.summary: Audio Device Collection
member.remarks: Objects of this class may be used to iterate through available audio devices present in the system. For example, by creating a specifying AudioDeviceCategory.Output to its constructor, it will be possible to iterate through all available output devices detected by DirectSound. To list capture devices, use AudioDeviceCategory.Capture instead.

example.para: The source code below shows a typical usage of AudioDeviceCollection.

member.name: P:Accord.DirectSound.AudioDeviceCollection.Default
member.summary: Gets the default audio device of the chosen category.
member.value: The default audio device of the chosen category.

member.name: P:Accord.DirectSound.AudioDeviceCollection.Category
member.summary: Gets the category of the audio devices listed by this collection.

member.name: M:Accord.DirectSound.AudioDeviceCollection.#ctor(Accord.DirectSound.AudioDeviceCategory)
member.summary: Creates a class containing devices of the given category.
member.param: The category of the devices.

member.name: M:Accord.DirectSound.AudioDeviceCollection.GetEnumerator
member.summary: Returns an enumerator that iterates through the device collection.
member.returns: A that can be used to iterate through the collection.

member.name: M:Accord.DirectSound.AudioDeviceCollection.System#Collections#IEnumerable#GetEnumerator
member.summary: Returns an enumerator that iterates through the device collection.
member.returns: An object that can be used to iterate through the collection.

member.name: T:Accord.DirectSound.AudioOutputDevice
member.summary: Audio output device for local audio playback (i.e. a sound card port).

remarks.para: This audio output sends audio data to a local output device such as a sound card. The audio is reproduced using DirectSound through SlimDX.
For instructions on how to list output devices, please see the documentation page.

example.para: For more details regarding usage, please check one of the Audio sample applications accompanying the framework.

member.name: P:Accord.DirectSound.AudioOutputDevice.IsRunning
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this instance is playing audio.
member.value: true if this instance is running; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Accord.DirectSound.AudioOutputDevice.SamplingRate
member.summary: Gets the sampling rate for the current output device.

member.name: P:Accord.DirectSound.AudioOutputDevice.Channels
member.summary: Gets the number of channels for the current output device.

member.name: P:Accord.DirectSound.AudioOutputDevice.Owner
member.summary: Gets the parent owner form for the device.

member.name: P:Accord.DirectSound.AudioOutputDevice.Output
member.summary: Audio output.
member.remarks: Audio output is represented by Guid of audio output device.

member.name: E:Accord.DirectSound.AudioOutputDevice.FramePlayingStarted
member.summary: Raised when a frame starts playing.

member.name: E:Accord.DirectSound.AudioOutputDevice.NewFrameRequested
member.summary: Raised when a frame starts playing.

member.name: E:Accord.DirectSound.AudioOutputDevice.Stopped
member.summary: Indicates all frames have been played and the audio finished.

member.name: E:Accord.DirectSound.AudioOutputDevice.AudioOutputError
member.summary: Audio output error event.
member.remarks: This event is used to notify clients about any type of errors occurred in audio output object, for example internal exceptions.

member.name: M:Accord.DirectSound.AudioOutputDevice.#ctor(System.IntPtr,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Constructs a new Audio Output Device.
member.param: The owner window handle.
The sampling rate of the device.
The number of channels of the device.

member.name: M:Accord.DirectSound.AudioOutputDevice.#ctor(System.Guid,System.IntPtr,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Constructs a new Audio Output Device.
member.param: Global identifier of the audio output device.
The owner window handle.
The sampling rate of the device.
The number of channels of the device.

member.name: M:Accord.DirectSound.AudioOutputDevice.Play(System.Single[])
member.summary: Starts playing the current buffer.

member.name: M:Accord.DirectSound.AudioOutputDevice.Play
member.summary: Starts playing the current buffer.

member.name: M:Accord.DirectSound.AudioOutputDevice.WorkerThread
member.summary: Worker thread.

member.name: M:Accord.DirectSound.AudioOutputDevice.Stop
member.summary: Stops playing the current buffer.

member.name: M:Accord.DirectSound.AudioOutputDevice.SignalToStop
member.summary: Signals audio output to stop its work.
member.remarks: Signals audio output to stop its background thread, stop to ask for new frames and free resources.

member.name: M:Accord.DirectSound.AudioOutputDevice.WaitForStop
member.summary: Wait for audio output has stopped.
member.remarks: Waits for output stopping after it was signaled to stop using method.

member.summary: Performs application-defined tasks associated with freeing, releasing, or resetting unmanaged resources.

member.summary: Releases unmanaged and - optionally - managed resources
member.param: true to release both managed and unmanaged resources; false to release only unmanaged resources.

member.summary: Releases unmanaged resources and performs other cleanup operations before the is reclaimed by garbage collection.

member.name: T:Accord.DirectSound.AudioDeviceInfo
member.summary: Audio device information.
member.remarks: This class holds information about a particular audio device, such as a microphone, audio card port or anything else which could be detected by DirectSound. Objects from this class are typically obtained through a collection.

member.name: P:Accord.DirectSound.AudioDeviceInfo.Description
member.summary: Gets the description of the device.

member.name: P:Accord.DirectSound.AudioDeviceInfo.Guid
member.summary: Gets the unique id of the device.
member.value: The Global Unique Identifier of the device.

member.name: M:Accord.DirectSound.AudioDeviceInfo.ToString
member.summary: Returns a representing the audio device.
member.returns: A that represents the audio device.

member.name: T:Accord.DirectSound.WaveFileAudioSource
member.summary: Read audio samples from a Wave file.

remarks.para: This audio source reads audio samples from Wave files. Internally, it uses the class to automatically decode Wave files into audio signals.

member.name: E:Accord.DirectSound.WaveFileAudioSource.NewFrame
member.summary: Event raised when a new frame has arrived.

member.name: E:Accord.DirectSound.WaveFileAudioSource.AudioSourceError
member.summary: Event raised when an error occurs in the audio source.

member.name: P:Accord.DirectSound.WaveFileAudioSource.Source
member.summary: Gets or sets the file source path.

member.name: P:Accord.DirectSound.WaveFileAudioSource.DesiredFrameSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the desired frame size to use when reading this source.

member.name: P:Accord.DirectSound.WaveFileAudioSource.Channels
member.summary: Gets the number of audio channels in the wave file.

member.name: P:Accord.DirectSound.WaveFileAudioSource.FramesReceived
member.summary: Gets the quantity of frames received.

member.name: P:Accord.DirectSound.WaveFileAudioSource.BytesReceived
member.summary: Gets the quantity of bytes received.

member.name: P:Accord.DirectSound.WaveFileAudioSource.UserData
member.summary: Gets or sets a user-defined tag associated with this object.

member.name: P:Accord.DirectSound.WaveFileAudioSource.IsRunning
member.summary: Gets whether this source is active or not.

member.name: M:Accord.DirectSound.WaveFileAudioSource.Start
member.summary: Starts reading from the source.

member.summary: Signals the source to stop.

member.name: M:Accord.DirectSound.WaveFileAudioSource.WaitForStop
member.summary: Blocks the calling thread until the source has stopped.

member.name: M:Accord.DirectSound.WaveFileAudioSource.Stop
member.summary: Stops the source.

member.param: The stream containing a Wave file.

member.name: M:Accord.Audio.Formats.WaveDecoder.read(System.Single[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads a maximum of count samples from the current stream, and writes the data to buffer, beginning at index.
member.param: When this method returns, this parameter contains the specified byte array with the values between index and (index + count -1) replaced by the 8 bit frames read from the current source.
The amount of frames to read.
member.returns: The number of reads performed on the stream.

member.returns: The number of reads performed on the stream.

member.summary: Reads a maximum of count frames from the current stream, and writes the data to buffer, beginning at index.

The amount of frames to read.
member.returns: The number of reads performed on the stream.

The amount of frames to read.
member.returns: The number of reads performed on the stream.
